titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Francis Norton Papers
titlestmt.author: Joshua Hauck-Whealton

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created with EADitor by Joshua Hauck-Whealton
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: The papers of Francis J. Norton contain lab notebooks and binders dealing with Norton's laboratory work in General Electric Atmospheric Sciences Research Center.

note.p: Creation of this finding aid was supported by a grant from the Center for History of Physics, American Institute of Physics.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this record group is unrestricted.

bioghist.p: Francis Norton was a researcher at GE R&D during World War II who helped develop the mass spectrometer. After retiring form GE, Norton continued his research at the Atmospheric Sciences Research Center at the University of Albany.

scopecontent.p: 25 notebooks kept by Francis Norton documenting his research at the General Electric Research Laboratory, 5 notebooks of research from the Atmospheric Sciences Research Center, and 17 additional notebooks maintained by Norton, most of which are likely associated with his work at GE.
